channel.title: Login Message
channel.description:
when i add a login message i cannot make it saying the player has logged in to everyone cause i get error with the 'yell' thing
source: delta (evolutionx)
[code]client.java:11839: cannot find symbol symbol : method yell(java.lang.String) location: class client yell("Owner And Coder, Divine Alex Has Logged In!"); ^ client.java:11842: cannot find symbol symbol : method yell(java.lang.String) location: class client yell("Owner And Hoster, Phil Has Logged In!"); ^ client.java:11845: cannot find symbol symbol : method yell(java.lang.String) location: class client yell("Player "+playerName+" Has Logged In!"); ^ client.java:11848: cannot find symbol symbol : method yell(java.lang.String) location: class client yell("Moderator "+playerName+" Has Logged In!"); ^ client.java:11851: cannot find symbol symbol : method yell(java.lang.String) location: class client yell("Administrator "+playerName+" Has Logged In!"); ^ client.java:11854: cannot find symbol symbol : method yell(java.lang.String) location: class client yell("Co-Owner "+playerName+" Has Logged In!"); ^ client.java:11857: cannot find symbol symbol : method yell(java.lang.String) location: class client yell("Hidden Owner "+playerName+" Has Logged In!"); ^ client.java:11860: cannot find symbol symbol : method yell(java.lang.String) location: class client yell("Donator "+playerName+" Has Logged In!"); ^ 8 errors Finished! Appuyez sur une touche pour continuer...[/code]

public void yell(String message) { for (Player p : handler.players) { if ((p == null)) continue; client temp = (client) p; if ((temp.absX > 0) && (temp.absY > 0)) if ((temp != null) && !temp.disconnected) temp.sM(message); } }[/quote]i fucking love you bro

public void yell(String message) { for (Player p : handler.players) { if ((p == null)) continue; client temp = (client) p; if ((temp.absX > 0) && (temp.absY > 0)) if ((temp != null) && !temp.disconnected) temp.sM(message); } }

item.title: Login Message
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

If you declare a method without a body it has to be declared in an interface or abstract class, like the run() method in the Runnable interface is.
